enWisdom: How bad a food the forbidden [food] is!
The worst kind of earning is the unlawful [earning]

Wisdom: لَمْ يَكْتَسِبْ مَالًا مَنْ لَمْ يُصْلِحْهُ
enWisdom: He who does not reform his [means of earning or spending] wealth has not earned it

Wisdom: مَنِ اتَّجَرَ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ فَقَدِ ارْتَطَمَ فِي الرِّبَا
enWisdom: One who carries out transactions without knowledge, falls into usury

Wisdom: مَنِ اكْتَسَبَ مَالًا مِنْ غَيْرِ حِلِّهِ أَضَرَّ بِآخِرَتِهِ
enWisdom: One who earns his wealth from unlawful sources damages his Hereafter
One who earns by unlawful means accumulates sins

Wisdom: مَنْ يَكْتَسِبْ مَالًا مِنْ غَيْرِ حِلِّهِ يَصْرِفْهُ فِي غَيْرِ حَقِّهِ
enWisdom: One who earns wealth from sources that are unlawful, spends it in the places that are unworthy [and inappropriate]
Collecting the [wealth that is] forbidden is part of wretchedness
